title: Quick start guide
text: Let’s use Fleiss dataset, quoted epitools package (Fleiss, 1981, p. 249 ). Fleiss data present events (count object) population (population object) six age groups five different groups (1 5+). tidyrates package present Fleiss data tidy way, tibble long format. key variable refers groups, age_group age groups, name separates values events population. may use structure use case data.

title: Quick start guide
text: Fleiss example uses average population standard population reference. Using tidyrates, must supply tibble two variables: age group population.

title: Quick start guide
text: use direct adjustment procedure, tidyrate present rate_adj_direct function. .data argument must tibble events population data, .std argument must standard population tibble. .keys argument must point grouping variables .data tibble, available. rate_adj_direct compute crude rate, adjusted rate exact confidence intervals group.

title: Quick start guide
text: Let’s use Selvin dataset, quoted epitools package (Selvin, 2004). tidyrates present dataset tidy way.

title: Quick start guide
text: tidyrates present dataset tidy way.

title: Quick start guide
text: use indirect adjustment procedure, tidyrate present rate_adj_indirect function. .data argument must tibble events population data, .std argument must also tibble events population data. .keys argument must point grouping variables .data tibble, available. rate_adj_indirect compute crude rate, adjusted rate exact confidence intervals group.
code: rate_adj_indirect(selvin_data_1940, selvin_data_1960) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   crude.rate adj.rate     lci     uci #>        <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1    0.00120  0.00120 0.00119 0.00120

title: Tidy Epidemiological Rates
text: goal tidyrates compute adjusted rates epidemiological indicators tidy way, wrapping functions epitools package.

text: can install development version tidyrates GitHub :

title: Fleiss data — fleiss_data
text: Fleiss dataset epitools package examples, event counts population per age group tidy format.

title: Fleiss data — fleiss_data
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 60 rows 4 columns.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling rhs(lhs).

what: Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_direct
title: Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_direct
text: Computes direct adjusted rates confidence intervals.

title: Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_direct
Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_direct
text: .data tibble containing events counts population per groups (e.g. age groups) .std vector standard population values group .keys Optional. character vector grouping variables, like year region code. .name_var Variable containing variable names. Defaults name. .value_var Variable containing values. Defaults value. .age_group_var Variable name age groups. Defaults age_group. .age_group_pop_var Variable name population size .std. Defaults population. .events_label Label used events name_var variable. Defaults events. .population_label Label used population name_var variable. Defautls population. .progress Whether show progress bar. Defaults TRUE.

title: Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_direct
text: tibble crude adjusted rate, lower upper confidence intervals.

title: Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_direct
text: functions wraps epitools ageadjust.direct function compute direct adjusted rates "exact" confidence intervals using tibble objects multiple grouping keys. tibble (.data) must informed containing key variables like year region code, population events count (e.g. cases) per age group. Check fleiss_data example. tibble (.std) must also supplied containing age groups population size. default, tibble two variables, named age_group pop.

title: Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_direct
code: standard_pop <- tibble::tibble(    age_group = c("Under 20", "20-24", "25-29", "30-34", "35-39", "40 and over"),    population = c(63986.6, 186263.6, 157302.2, 97647.0, 47572.6, 12262.6)  ) rate_adj_direct(fleiss_data, .std = standard_pop) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   crude.rate adj.rate     lci     uci #>        <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1   0.000895  0.00437 0.00414 0.00546

what: Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_indirect

text: Computes indirect adjusted rates confidence intervals.

title: Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_indirect
Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_indirect
text: .data tibble containing events counts population per groups (e.g. age groups) .std vector standard population values group .keys Optional. character vector grouping variables, like year region code. .name_var Variable containing variable names. Defaults name. .value_var Variable containing values. Defaults value. .age_group_var Variable name age groups. Defaults age_group. .age_group_pop_var Variable name population size .std. Defaults population. .events_label Label used events name_var variable. Defaults events. .population_label Label used population name_var variable. Defautls population. .progress Whether show progress bar. Defaults TRUE.

title: Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_indirect
text: tibble crude adjusted rate, lower upper confidence intervals.

title: Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_indirect
text: functions wraps epitools ageadjust.indirect function compute indirect adjusted rates "exact" confidence intervals using tibble objects multiple grouping keys. tibble (.data) must informed containing key variables like year region code, population events count (e.g. cases) per age group. Check fleiss_data example. tibble (.std) must also supplied containing age groups, events population size. default, tibble three variables, named age_group, name value. Check selvin_data_1940 example.

title: Compute direct adjusted rates with tibbles — rate_adj_indirect
code: rate_adj_indirect(.data = selvin_data_1960, .std = selvin_data_1940) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   crude.rate adj.rate     lci     uci #>        <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1    0.00166  0.00166 0.00165 0.00167
